body:
I actually figured it out shortly after while working on filters - I was trying to return an object from an anon function, like so:
`whatever={ ()=>{ my: 'object' } }`

but the linter would complain unless the returned object is wrapped in parens:
`whatever={ ()=>({ my: 'object' }) }`
body_html:
I actually figured it out shortly after while working on filters - I was trying to return an object from an anon function, like so:
whatever={ ()=>{ my: 'object' } }

but the linter would complain unless the returned object is wrapped in parens:
whatever={ ()=>({ my: 'object' }) }
